articles.description: If you own a Nintendo console and have a Nintendo Account, then you may want to double check your security settings. Over the weekend, reports of third-party log-ins began creeping in, indicating that
articles.content:
If you own a Nintendo console and have a Nintendo Account, then you may want to double check your security settings. Over the weekend, reports of third-party log-ins began creeping in, indicating that some kind of breach has taken place. 
Nintendo has not co… [+893 chars]

articles.title: Drum machine app uses your smartphone as a virtual 'pedal' - Engadget
articles.description: If you’re a musician looking to add drum beats or loops via a pedal, a Finnish company called Kovaluu has unveiled a cheap solution. Its app for iOS and Android, called Beats and Loops, transforms your smartphone into a virtual pedal. You can trigger a loop o…
articles.content: The drum machine comes with 50 drum presets, along with fills and A/B parts that can be triggered hands-free. It also has a looper with unlimited overdubs so that you can trigger backing parts while you play. “The looper can be used with just the phone microp… [+987 chars]

articles.title: Realme 6 Pro review: The mid-ranger to beat (Updated with video) - Android Authority
articles.description: Is the Realme 6 Pro the new mid-ranger to beat?
articles.content: It seems like, with every successive review of a mid-range smartphone, I end up repeating myself. Consumers have never had it this good. The mid-range segment is where the competition is at its most fierce, and Chinese players are making a killing. Amongst th… [+9555 chars]

articles.author: Jon Porter
articles.title: LG teases new 5G Velvet phone with ‘raindrop’ camera - The Verge
articles.description: LG has released a short teaser trailer for its upcoming Velvet smartphone. It gives us a clearer look at its design, and confirms that it will run on a Snapdragon 5G 765 processor, and confirms it’ll have a headphone jack.
articles.content: Powered by a Snapdragon 5G 765
